result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ryan L Bliffert was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit for 14 days granted if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  Paid in full.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Oconomowoc Police Department.  Cash applied to costs.  Paid in full.

Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting already completed.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

3-31-2016: ATC Graduate - Completed all terms and conditions of program serving 58 wks in ATC. Jail portion is modified to TIME SERVED in custody of 30 days.

AMENDED 08-09-2016:  JAIL PORTION IS MODIFIED FROM 250 DAYS TO TIME SERVED IN CUSTODY OF 179 DAYS, SATISFYING REQUIRED STATUTORY MINIMUM WITH GOOD TIME CREDIT.

Received August 22, 2016, dated August 16, 2016 from DOC requesting clarification of probation terms order for Count 1.
Dated 04/26/16, from DOC, requesting clarification of sentence. (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 05-04-16, send back to ATC)

Defendant Ryan L Bliffert in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

March 31, 2016: ATC GRADUATE.  COMPLETED ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF PROGRAM BY SERVING 58 WEEKS IN ATC.  JAIL PORTION IS MODIFIED TO ACTUAL TIME SERVED IN CUSTODY OF 30 DAYS. ANY REMAINING JAIL TIME IS PERMANENTLY VACATED AND JOC IS AMENDED ACCORDINGLY.
Defendant Ryan L Bliffert in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant remains compliant with the program.

It is hereby ordered, that on February 13, 2015 at 8:30 am the above named defendant, as an ATC participant, be released to Wisconsin Community Services for placement on the SCRAM monitoring system until further order of the Court.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Ryan L Bliffert in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following: 
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 14 days.
- 2 years Probation
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting already completed.  
- Fine of $2,023.00; cash bail to be applied.
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Oconomowoc Police Department; cash bail to be applied.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00; cash bail to be applied.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

CONDITION TIME: 250 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to have no contact with any witness listed in the complaint.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program within 1 business day of his release.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring within 1 business day of his release.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.
